sen.j: 折り紙（おりがみ、折紙）とは、紙を折って動植物や生活道具などの形を作る日本伝統の遊び。
sen.e: Origami is Japanese traditional play of folding paper to make models of plants, animals, daily-use tools and amongst others.
Origami is the traditional Japanese art of folding paper to make models of plants, animals, daily-use tools and amongst others.
Origami is the traditional Japanese art of folding paper to make models of plants, animals, daily-use tools and amongst others.

sen.j: また、折り上げられた作品そのものや、折り紙用に作られた正方形の専用紙のことも指す。
sen.e: It also refers to a folded paper model itself or square paper exclusively for origami.
It also refers to a folded paper model itself or a piece of square paper used exclusively for origami.
It also refers to a folded paper model itself or a piece of square paper used exclusively for origami.

sen.j: 近年では折り紙の芸術的側面が再評価され、昔にはなかった複雑で優れた作品が生み出されている。
sen.e: Recently, it has been recognized from the artistic aspect, and elaborated beautiful designs unseen in the past have been created.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Recently, it has been recognized from its artistic aspect, and original, elaborate, designs of beauty have been created.
Recently, it has been recognized from its artistic aspect, and original, elaborate, designs of beauty have been created.

sen.j: 各国に伝承する折り方に加えて、新しい折り方も考案され続けている。
sen.e: In addition to the traditional way of folding paper in every country, new ways of folding paper are being invented.

sen.e: In addition to the traditional way of folding paper in every country, new ways of folding paper are also being invented.

sen.j: また、折り紙の持つ幾何学的な性質から、数学の一分野としても研究されている。
sen.e: Due to the geometric feature of origami, it has been studied as a field of mathematics.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Due to the geometric feature of origami, it has been studied as a field of mathematics.

sen.j: 古くは千代紙（ちよがみ）と呼ばれる彩色豊かな紙を使用した。
sen.e: In the past, colorful paper called chiyogami was used for origami.
In the past, colorful paper called chiyogami was used for origami.

sen.j: この為、折り紙の紙を千代紙という場合もある。
sen.e: Therefore, origami paper can be called chiyogami.
Therefore, origami paper can be called chiyogami.
Therefore, origami paper can be called chiyogami.

sen.j: また、近年では伝統工芸品としても千代紙が販売されている。
sen.e: Recently, the chiyogami has been sold as traditional art work.
Recently, chiyogami has been sold as traditional art work.
Recently, chiyogami has been sold as traditional art work.

sen.j: 現在の折り紙は、多くの場合、使用する紙は一枚で、はさみや糊などは使用しないが、2枚の紙を使うもの（例 手裏剣）やはさみで切り込みを入れるものもある。
sen.e: In many cases, origami models are made of a sheet of paper without using scissors and glue now, but scissors is used to cut paper for certain designs which require two sheets of paper, for example shuriken (a small throwing blade).

In many cases, origami models are made of a sheet of paper without using scissors or glue, but scissors are used to cut paper for certain designs which require two sheets of paper, for example shuriken (a small throwing blade).

sen.j: また、複雑な作品や折り目がつきにくい場合などにはヘラを用いることもある。
sen.e: A folding bone may be used if an intricate model is made or it is hard to make a crease in paper.

sen.j: 緻密に、折ったり、折り目の間の空間に折り目の一端を挟み込むなどして、形を作り上げていく。
sen.e: A model is made by folding paper carefully or tucking one end of the folded paper into a pocket.

sen.j: 折り続けていくため、折り始める前の紙の大きさに比べ、出来上がった形はかなり小さなものになることもある。
sen.e: Because paper is folded continuously, a completed model can be rather smaller than the unfolded paper.
Because paper is folded continuously, a completed model can be much smaller than the unfolded paper.
Because paper is folded continuously, a completed model can be much smaller than the unfolded paper.

sen.j: 代表的な折り紙には、鶴（折鶴、連鶴）、風船、紙飛行機、手裏剣、兜、奴さんなどがある。
sen.e: Typical origami models include cranes (folded paper crane or connected cranes), balloons, paper airplanes, shuriken, kabuto (a samurai war helmet) and yakkosan (a samurai's attendant).
Typical origami models include cranes (folded paper crane or connected cranes), balloons, paper airplanes, shuriken, kabuto (a samurai war helmet) and yakkosan (a samurai's attendant).

sen.j: ヨーロッパでは、スペイン語でパハリータ、フランス語でココットと呼ばれる小鳥（または鶏）の形をした折り紙が代表的である。
sen.e: Typical European origami model is a small bird (or hen) called pajarito in Spanish and cocotte in French.
A typical European origami model includes a small bird (or hen) called pajarito in Spanish and cocotte in French.
A typical European origami model includes a small bird (or hen) called pajarito in Spanish and cocotte in French.

sen.j: また、洋食のときに折られているナプキンも、広義の折り紙の一種である。
sen.e: Folded napkins for western dishes are also a type of origami in a broad sense.
In a broad sense, folded napkins for western dishes are also a type of origami.

sen.j: 「ふせつせいほうけいいちまいおり」と読む。
sen.e: It is called "fusetsu seihokei ichimaiori" in Japanese.

sen.j: 折り紙のうち、はさみを使用せず、正方形の紙一枚だけを用いた折り紙をこう呼ぶ。
sen.e: Only a sheet of square paper is used for it without using scissors.

sen.j: 原理主義的な折り紙であり、この折り紙を好む人は多いようである。
sen.e: It is a fundamental origami, which many people seem to like.

sen.j: 対象をいくつかの部分に分けて折り、それを組み合わせて作品を作る折り方。
sen.e: It consists of combining some different models to make an intended model.
It consists of combining different models to make the end model.

sen.j: 伝承的なものでは、『奴さん』と『袴』を組み合わせたもの。
sen.e: A traditional fukugo origami is a combined model of yakkosan and hakama (a pleated and divided skirt).
A traditional fukugo origami is a combined model of yakkosan and hakama (a pleated and divided skirt).

sen.j: 紙に切り込みを入れなくても比較的簡単に複雑な形を表現でき、また色違いの紙を使うことでカラフルな作品に仕上げることもできる。
sen.e: Intricate models can be expressed by a relatively easy way without cutting paper, and colorful designs can be achieved by using paper in different colors.
Intricate models can be expressed relatively easily without cutting paper, and colorful designs can be achieved by using paper in different colors.

sen.j: 組み立てる際に糊や針金などを使う場合がある。
sen.e: When the models are put together, glue or wires may be used.

sen.j: 紙に切り込みを入れてカドの数を増やしたり、一部を切り取ったりすることによって複雑な形を折りやすくする折り方。
sen.e: It is to facilitate the creation of intricate models by cutting paper to increase corners of paper or cutting off a part of paper.

sen.j: 折り紙愛好者からは邪道扱いされることも多いが、「不切正方形一枚折りにこだわって折り方が複雑になりすぎるより良い」という意見もある。
sen.e: Many origami fans see it as an improper way of doing, but some says that, "It is better than to be complicated by sticking to the fusetsu seihokei ichimaiori (single square-paper folding without cutting).

sen.j: 『秘伝千羽鶴折型』に見られるようなつなぎ折り鶴は、はさみを利用して作る。

tit.cmt: 「ユニット折り紙」の英訳は<http://www.happyfolding.com/term-modular>を参考にしました。
ユニットはunitの方がよいと思います。

sen.j: 何枚もの紙を同じ形に折る。
sen.e: A number of identical pieces are made by using multiple sheets of paper.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: A number of identical pieces are made by using multiple sheets of paper.

sen.j: それらを組み合わせ、一つの作品を作りあげる折り紙作品をユニット折り紙と呼ぶ。
sen.e: It consists of putting those pieces together to make a complete model.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It consists of putting those pieces together to make a complete model.

sen.j: ユニット折り紙の対象には対称性の高い多面体（一般に「くすだま」と呼ばれるものなど）、箱などが多い。
sen.e: It usually includes polyhedral objects with high symmetry such as a model generally called kusudama (decorative paper ball), and boxes.
It usually includes polyhedral objects with high symmetry such as a model generally called kusudama (decorative paper ball), and boxes.
It usually includes polyhedral objects with high symmetry such as a model generally called kusudama (decorative paper ball), and boxes.

sen.j: 枚数としては2枚から数十枚、多いものでは1万枚以上もの紙を組み合わせることがある。
sen.e: Two to dozens of, or at most, more than ten thousand pieces may be put together.

sen.j: ユニットを組み合わせるときには、紙の摩擦のみで全体を支えるものが理想であるが、場合により糊付けや糸で綴じるケースもある。
sen.e: When the unit pieces are put together, it is preferable to support the whole model only by friction of paper, but they can be glued together or sewn by threads.

sen.j: 古くは『カメラ』（シャッターが開く）や『羽ばたく鳥』（首としっぽを持って羽根を動かせる）など。

sen.j: 折り紙には、基本形というものがいくつかある。
sen.e: There are some bases in origami.

sen.j: 例えば、鶴の基本形は4つのとがった「カド」を持っており、動物を折る場合ならこれらを頭や足に当てることで創作が容易になる。
sen.e: For example, the crane base has four angular corners, which are applied to a head and legs to facilitate the creation of animal models.

sen.j: 複雑な作品を折る場合には、金属箔を利用したホイル紙や、薄い和紙（破れにくい）の裏に金属箔（例えばアルミホイル。形が崩れにくくなる）を裏打ちした自作の用紙が用いられることが多い。
sen.e: When intricate models are made, foil paper made of metal leaf or home-made paper made by lining (untearable) thin washi (Japanese paper) with metal leaf (for example, aluminum foil to avoid losing shape) is used.

sen.e: For models to be exhibited, in many cases, Western or Japanese paper selected for appearance is cut into a square (or an appropriate shape for them) to make them.

sen.j: 厚手の紙（洋紙など）を随時、適度に湿らせてから折る、ウェットフォールディングという技法も使われる。
sen.e: Wet folding, a technique to dampen thick paper (such as Western paper) moderately as needed before folding, is used as well.

sen.j: この技法を用いると、厚い紙を簡単に折ったり、皺を大幅に減らすことができる。
sen.e: If this technique is used, thick paper can be easily folded or creases can be considerably reduced.
If this technique is used, thick paper can be easily folded or creases can be considerably reduced.
If this technique is used, thick paper can be easily folded or creases can be considerably reduced.

sen.j: また、曲がった形を固定したり、紙を伸ばして（歪ませて）折ることもできる。
sen.e: It allows curved shape to be fixed and paper to be folded with it stretched (or distorted).
It allows curved shape to be fixed and paper to be folded with it stretched (or distorted).
It allows curved shape to be fixed and paper to be folded with it stretched (or distorted).

sen.j: 周りに正方形の紙がなくとも、例えば目の前にあるいらない書類などを工夫して正方形に整えれば、予め用紙を用意してなくとも折り紙を十分に楽しむことが出来る。
sen.e: Even if there is not a square paper around, origami can be fully enjoyed with paper made by shaping unwanted documents in hand into a square with a little ingenuity, and therefore it is not necessary to prepare origami paper in advance.

Even if square paper is not available, origami can be fully enjoyed with paper made by shaping unwanted documents in hand into a square with a little ingenuity, and therefore it is not necessary to prepare origami paper in advance.

Even if square paper is not available, origami can be fully enjoyed with paper made by shaping unwanted documents in hand into a square with a little ingenuity, and therefore it is not necessary to prepare origami paper in advance.

sen.j: 折り紙の折り方を人に伝えるため、その工程を絵（しばしば写真）で示す折り図が存在する。
sen.e: To tell people the way of folding origami, there is a folding diagram which shows the process with symbols (usually in pictures).
There is a folding diagram which shows the process with symbols (usually in pictures), allowing people to understand how to fold a piece of origami.
There is a folding diagram which shows the process with symbols (usually in pictures), allowing people to understand how to fold a piece of origami.

sen.j: 折り図では、慣例的に、山折り線を一点鎖線（「―・―・―・―・―」）、谷折り線を破線（「― ― ― ― ―」）で表すことが多い。
sen.e: Conventionally, in the diagram, dashed-dotted lines ("-・-・-・-・-") and broken lines ("- - - - -") show the mountain fold and the valley fold, respectively.
Conventionally, in the diagram, dashed-dotted lines ("-・-・-・-・-") and broken lines ("- - - - -") show the mountain fold and the valley fold, respectively.
Conventionally, in the diagram, dashed-dotted lines ('-・-・-・-・-') and broken lines ('- - - - -') show the mountain fold and the valley fold, respectively.

sen.j: また、理解を容易にするため文章が添えられることも多い。
sen.e: In many cases, to facilitate understanding, instructions in writing are added to the diagram.
In many cases, to facilitate understanding, instructions in writing are added to the diagram.
In many cases, to facilitate understanding, instructions in writing are added to the diagram.

sen.j: 折り紙では、基本的な折り方に以下がある。
sen.e: In origami, there are basic folds as follows:

sen.j: 折り紙の起源は明らかになっていない。
sen.e: The origin of origami has not been identified.
The origin of origami has not been identified.
The origin of origami has not been identified.

sen.j: 中国起源説、日本起源説、スペイン起源説等があるが、いずれも推測の域を出ない。
sen.e: Its possible origin includes China, Japan, Spain and amongst others, but remains a matter of speculation.
Its possible origin includes China, Japan, Spain amongst others, but remains a matter of speculation.
Its possible origin includes China, Japan, Spain amongst others, but remains a matter of speculation.

sen.j: 中国起源説は製紙の起源が中国であることから、折り紙の起源の起源も中国であろうとの説で根拠は乏しい。
sen.e: There is speculation that origami was originated in China because paper was originated in China, but there is no strong evidence.
There is speculation that origami originated in China because paper originated in China, but as yet there is no strong evidence.
There is speculation that origami originated in China because paper originated in China, but as yet there is no strong evidence.

sen.j: 日本の折り紙は下記のように他から伝わったものではなく独自に発達したもののようである。
sen.e: Japanese origami seemed to be developed on its own, not to be introduced by others as described below.
Japanese origami seemed to have developed on its own, was not introduced by others as described below.
Japanese origami seemed to have developed on its own, was not introduced by others as described below.

sen.j: 19世紀にはヨーロッパにも独立した折り紙の伝統があり、日本の開国と共に両者が融合した。
sen.e: In the 19th century, Europe had its independent origami tradition, which was fused with the Japanese origami when Japan was opened to the world.
In the 19th century, Europe had its own independent origami tradition, which was fused with Japanese origami when Japan opened up to the world.
In the 19th century, Europe had its own independent origami tradition, which was fused with Japanese origami when Japan opened up to the world.

sen.j: 現在では日本語の「折り紙」という言葉が世界に浸透しており、欧米をはじめ多くの国で「origami」という言葉が通用する。
sen.e: Now, the Japanese term "origami" has become prevalent in the world and the "origami" is understood in many countries including Europe and America.
Now, the Japanese term "origami" has become prevalent in the world and the "origami" is understood in many countries including Europe and America.
Now, the Japanese term 'origami' has become prevalent in the world and the "origami" is understood in many countries including Europe and America.

sen.j: 現代の折り紙は日本やヨーロッパを起源とするものである。
sen.e: The current origami was originated in Japan and Europe.
Modern origami originated in Japan and Europe.
Modern origami originated in Japan and Europe.

sen.j: 日本の折り紙は大きく2種類に分けることができる。
sen.e: The Japanese origami can be categorized into two.
The Japanese origami can be split into two categories.
The Japanese origami can be split into two categories.

sen.j: 一般に知られている折り鶴などの折り紙は遊戯折り紙と呼ばれ、熨斗などの折り紙は儀礼折り紙（または礼法折り紙）と呼ばれる。
sen.e: Origami like the paper crane model commonly known is called yugi origami (play paper folding), and the other origami like noshi (folded red and white paper) is called girei origami (ceremonial paper folding).
sen.cmt: ここでの「熨斗」はのし紙の方だと思います。
sen.e: Origami like the paper crane model commonly seen is called yugi origami (play paper folding), and other origami like noshi (folded red and white paper) is called girei origami (ceremonial paper folding).

Origami like the paper crane model commonly seen is called yugi origami (play paper folding), and other origami like noshi (folded red and white paper) is called girei origami (ceremonial paper folding).

sen.j: 文献で確認できる限り、1680年に井原西鶴が「一昼夜独吟四千句」の中の一句「廬斉が夢の蝶はおりすえ」に詠んだ、雄蝶・雌蝶が最古の記録である。
sen.e: As far as literatures show, the earliest reference to the girei origami was ocho and mecho (male and female butterfly models) in the haiku, "butterflies in a beggar's dream are origami" composed by Saikaku IHARA in the "Ittyuya dokugin yonsenku (400 haiku recited alone all day and night)" in 1680.
sen.cmt: 文献のタイトルは直訳です。句の部分は、広辞苑より「廬斉：乞食の総称」、「折据え：折紙細工」を基に直訳しました。
sen.e: As far as is shown in literature, the earliest reference to the girei origami was ocho and mecho (male and female butterfly models) in the haiku, "butterflies in a beggar's dream are origami" composed by Saikaku IHARA in the "Ittyuya dokugin yonsenku (400 haiku recited alone all day and night)" in 1680.

As far as is shown in literature, the earliest reference to the girei origami was ocho and mecho (male and female butterfly models) in the haiku, 'butterflies in a beggar's dream are origami' composed by Saikaku IHARA in the 'Ittyuya Dokugin onsenku (4000 Haikus Recited Alone All Day and Night)" in 1680.

sen.j: 雄蝶・雌蝶は銚子の口に付けるもので、銚子の包みが様式化したものである。
sen.e: The ocho and mecho, which are attached to the mouth of a sake bottle, are stylized bottle wrappings.
The ocho and mecho, which are attached to the mouth of a sake bottle, are stylized bottle wrappings.
The ocho and mecho, which are attached to the mouth of a sake bottle, are stylized bottle wrappings.

sen.j: また、今日見られる熨斗も、熨斗鮑の包みが様式化したもので、儀礼折り紙の一例である。
sen.e: Furthermore, the current noshi is stylized noshi awabi (a thin strip of dried abalone wrapped in folded red and white paper), and an example of the girei origami.
Furthermore, the current noshi is a stylized noshi awabi (a thin strip of dried abalone wrapped in folded red and white paper), and an example of the girei origami.
Furthermore, the current noshi is a stylized noshi awabi (a thin strip of dried abalone wrapped in folded red and white paper), and an example of the girei origami.

sen.j: 儀礼折り紙は武家の礼法に含まれるもので、1764年に伊勢貞丈が著した『包之記』に「右の折形どもは、京都将軍の御代に用いられし折形也」という記述があるから、足利義満の時代、小笠原氏・伊勢氏・今川氏を中心に整えられたと考えられる。
sen.e: The girei origami is a part of warrior family's manners and it would appear that it was developed mainly by the Ogasawara clan, the Ise clan and the Imagawa clan in the day of Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA because "Tsutsumi no ki (record on wrapping)" written by Sadatake ISE in 1764 said that "the folded paper models on the right were used during the time of the Kyoto shogun."

The girei origami is a part of a warrior family's manners and it would appear that it was developed mainly by the Ogasawara clan, the Ise clan and the Imagawa clan in the day of Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA because "Tsutsumi no ki (record on wrapping)" written by Sadatake ISE in 1764 said that "the folded paper models on the right were used during the time of the Kyoto shogun."

The girei origami is a part of a warrior family's manners and it would appear that it was developed mainly by the Ogasawara clan, the Ise clan and the Imagawa clan in the days of Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA because "Tsutsumi no ki (record on wrapping)" written by Sadatake ISE in 1764 said that 'the folded paper models on the right were used during the time of the Kyoto shogun.'
sen.cmt: dayをdaysとしました。「」の部分は'としました。

sen.j: 井原西鶴の『好色一代男』（1682年）に
sen.e: The "koshoku ichidai otoko (life of an amorous man)" written by Saikaku IHARA in 1682 said that:
The "koshoku ichidai otoko (life of an amorous man)" written by Saikaku IHARA in 1682 said that:
The "Life of an Amorous Man" written by Saikaku IHARA in 1682 said that:

sen.j: 或時はおり居をあそばし、比翼の鳥のかたちは是ぞと、給はりける。
sen.e: One day he folded origami and gave it to a female servant, saying "This is the model of male and female birds in one."
sen.cmt: 吉行淳之介訳（中央公論）を参照(P10）
sen.e: One day he folded origami and gave it to a female servant, saying "This is a model of male and female birds in one."
One day he folded origami and gave it to a female servant, saying "This is a model of male and female birds in one."

sen.j: 花つくりて、梢にとりつけ、連理は是、我にとらすると。
sen.e: After making an origami flower, he attached it to the treetop and said, "This is the branch of a conjoined tree and I will give it to you."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処吉行淳之介訳（中央公論）を参照(P10）
sen.e: After making an origami flower, he attached it to the treetop and said, "This is the branch of a conjoined tree and I will give it to you."
After making an origami flower, he attached it to the treetop and said, "This is the branch of a conjoined tree and I will give it to you."

sen.j: よろづにつけて此事をのみ忘れず
sen.e: He never forgets anything about amorous affairs.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処吉行淳之介訳（中央公論）を参照(P10）
sen.e: He never forgot anything concerning amorous affairs.
He never forgot anything concerning amorous affairs.

sen.j: とあるのが、最も古い記録である。
sen.e: This is the oldest record on the yugi origami.
The following is the oldest record on yugi origami.
The above-stated is the oldest record on the yugi origami.

sen.j: 1797年に出版された『秘傳千羽鶴折形』は、明らかに大人向けに書かれており、当時から子供だけでなく大人にも折り紙を楽しむ人がいたことが分かる。
sen.e: The "Hiden Senbazuru Origata" published in 1797 was clearly targeted for adults, which proves that adults as well as children enjoyed origami in those days.
The "Hiden Senbazuru Origata" published in 1797 was clearly targeted towards adults, which proves that adults as well as children enjoyed origami in those days.
The "Hiden Senbazuru Origata" (Secret Folding of Thousand Cranes) published in 1797 was clearly targeted towards adults, which proves that adults as well as children enjoyed origami in those days.

sen.j: これが現存する世界最古の折り紙の文献とされている。
sen.e: This is considered as the oldest origami book in existence.
This is considered to be the oldest origami book in existence.
This is considered to be the oldest origami book in existence.

sen.j: 現存する折り紙でもっとも古いものとしては、森脇家旧蔵の作品群がある。
sen.e: The oldest origami in existence are origami models owned by the Moriwaki family.
The oldest origami in existence are origami models owned by the Moriwaki family.
The oldest origami in existence are origami models owned by the Moriwaki family.

sen.j: これには儀礼折り紙と遊戯折り紙の両方が含まれているが、遊戯折り紙については、19世紀前半に折られたものと推定されている。
sen.e: These models contain both the girei origami and the yugi origami, but the yugi origami was estimated to have been folded in the early 19th century.
These models contain both the girei origami and the yugi origami, but the yugi origami was estimated to have been folded in the early 19th century.
These models contain both the girei origami and the yugi origami, but the yugi origami was estimated to have been folded in the early 19th century.

sen.j: ドイツのゲルマン国立博物館およびザクセンフォークアート美術館に、19世紀前半に折られたものと推定されている作品群が所蔵されている。
sen.e: Germanisches National Museum and Saxon Folk Art Museum in Germany possess origami models which are estimated to have been folded in the early 19th century
Germanisches National Museum and Saxon Folk Art Museum in Germany possess origami models which are estimated to have been folded in the early 19th century

sen.cmt: 文末にピリオドを付けました。

sen.j: ヨーロッパの折り紙は、フリードリヒ・フレーベルの幼児教育法に取り入れられ、日本の開国にともない日本に伝わった。
sen.e: The European origami was applied to the child education of Friedrich Fröbel and introduced into Japan when Japan was opened to the world.
The European origami was applied to children education by Friedrich Fröbel and introduced to Japan when Japan was opened up to the world.
The European origami was applied to childhood education by Friedrich Fröbel and introduced to Japan when Japan was opened up to the world.
sen.cmt: 幼児教育をchildhood educationとしました。

sen.j: ヨーロッパの伝承作品として代表的なものに、パハリータ（ココット）、帆掛船（だまし船）、風船、紙飛行機（ダーツ）などが挙げられる。
sen.e: Typical European traditional origami includes pajarita (cocotte), a sailboat (trick boat), a balloon and a paper airplane (arrow).
Typical European traditional origami includes pajarita (cocotte), a sailboat (trick boat), a balloon and a paper airplane (arrow).
Typical European traditional origami includes pajarita (cocotte), a sailboat (trick boat), a balloon and a paper airplane (arrow).

sen.j: 1950年代には、日本の吉澤章、高濱利恵、イギリスのロバート・ハービン、アメリカのリリアン・オッペンハイマー、サミュエル・ランドレットらを中心とする国際的な折り紙サークルが形成され、折り紙が世界的に普及した。
sen.e: International origami groups were formed mainly by Akira YOSHIZAWA and Toshie TAKAHAMA from Japan, Robert Harbin from the UK and Liliane Oppenheimer and Samuel Randlett from the US, and then the origami was widely spread to the world.

International origami groups were formed mainly by Akira YOSHIZAWA and Toshie TAKAHAMA from Japan, Robert Harbin from the UK and Liliane Oppenheimer and Samuel Randlett from the US, after which, origami spread throughout the world.

International origami groups were formed mainly by Akira YOSHIZAWA and Toshie TAKAHAMA from Japan, Robert Harbin from the UK and Liliane Oppenheimer and Samuel Randlett from the US, after which, origami spread throughout the world.

sen.j: 1983年に発売となった、『ビバ!おりがみ』（前川淳 (折り紙)・笠原邦彦 著、ISBN 4387891165）、および1989年に発売となった『Folding the Universe』（ピーター・エンゲル著）が皮切りとなり、近年複雑な作品も作られるようになった。
sen.e: Recently, intricate models have been made, starting with "Viva Origami" (created by Jun MEKAWA; authored by Kunihiko KASAHARA: ISBN 4387891165) published in 1983 and "Folding the Universe" (authored by Peter Engel) published in 1989.

Recently, intricate models have been made, starting with "Viva Origami" (created by Jun MEKAWA; authored by Kunihiko KASAHARA: ISBN 4387891165) published in 1983 and "Folding the Universe" (authored by Peter Engel) published in 1989.

Recently, intricate models have been made, starting with "Viva Origami" (created by Jun MEKAWA; authored by Kunihiko KASAHARA: ISBN 4387891165) published in 1983 and "Folding the Universe" (authored by Peter Engel) published in 1989.

sen.j: 前川淳によって創始された「折り紙設計」の技法は特に大きな影響を与えており、これにより初めて複雑な作品を合理的にデザインできるようになった。
sen.e: The technique of "technical origami" developed by Jun Maekawa had big influence on origami, and allowed for the rational designing of intricate models for the first time.
The technique of "technical origami" developed by Jun Maekawa had a big influence on origami, and allowed for the rational designing of intricate models for the first time.
The technique of 'technical origami' developed by Jun MAEKAWA had a big influence on origami, and allowed for the rational designing of intricate models for the first time.
sen.cmt: に変更しました。名字を大文字にしました。

sen.j: 現在日本国内では日本折紙協会・日本折紙学会の両団体が存在する他、アメリカ・イギリスなど各国にも折り紙団体が結成されており、愛好者間の交流を深めている。
sen.e: While Nippon Origami Association and Japan Origami Academic Society have been established in Japan, origami groups have been formed in countries including the US and the UK, and then origami fans have deepened exchanges with each other.

When the Nippon Origami Association and Japan Origami Academic Society were established in Japan, origami groups formed in countries including the US and the UK, allowing origami fans to deepen exchanges with each other.

When the Nippon Origami Association and Japan Origami Academic Society were established in Japan, origami groups formed in countries including the US and the UK, allowing origami fans to deepen exchanges with each other.

sen.j: インターネットの普及などにもよって情報伝達の速度はいっそう上昇し、以前では考えられなかった速度で技術開発が進められるようになっている。
sen.e: Thanks to the spread of the Internet, the speed of communication got faster and technical development has proceeded at an unprecedented speed.
Thanks to the spread of the Internet, the speed of communication became faster and technical development has proceeded at an unprecedented speed.
Thanks to the spread of the Internet, the speed of communication became faster and technical development has proceeded at an unprecedented speed.

sen.j: ビー玉に対するビーダマン、けん玉に対するデジケン、ベーゴマに対するキャラコバッチ等と同様に、伝統玩具を商業玩具とする手法は折り紙に対しても実行された。
sen.e: Approach to commercialize traditional toys was applied to origami as well as marbles, kendama toy, and be-goma (spinning top) which were commercially developed into B-daman, DIGI-KEN, and characo badge (a badge doubled as a spinning top), respectively.

The commercialization of traditional toys was applied to origami as well as marbles, kendama toy, and be-goma (spinning top) which were commercially developed into B-daman, DIGI-KEN, and characo badge (a badge doubled as a spinning top), respectively.

The commercialization of traditional toys was applied to origami as well as marbles, kendama toy, and be-goma (spinning top) which were commercially developed into B-daman, DIGI-KEN, and characo badge (a badge doubled as a spinning top), respectively.

sen.j: タカラトミーからはオリガミウォーズ、コナミからはオリグライドが発売されている。
sen.e: TOMY Company, Ltd. and Konami Corporation have sold the Origami Wars and the Ori-glide: THE SUPER PAPER AIRPLANE, respectively.
sen.cmt: 「オリガミウォーズ」「オリグライド」が原文から漏れていましたので追加しました。「オリガミウォーズ」は直訳で、「オリグライド」は<http://www.konami.jp/th/ori-glide/>を参考。
sen.e: TOMY Company, Ltd. and Konami Corporation have sold the Origami Wars and the Ori-glide: THE SUPER PAPER AIRPLANE, respectively.
TOMY Company, Ltd. and Konami Corporation have sold the Origami Wars and the Ori-glide: THE SUPER PAPER AIRPLANE, respectively.

sen.j: 折紙戦士という漫画作品が台湾でかかれ、これをアニメ化。
sen.e: The cartoon called Origami senshi (origami warrior) was created in Taiwan and then made into anime.
The cartoon called Origami senshi (origami warrior) was created in Taiwan and then turned into an anime.
The cartoon called Origami senshi (origami warrior) was created in Taiwan and then turned into an anime.

sen.j: 折り紙の応用、または研究にはいくつもの数学的課題が含まれている。
sen.e: There are several mathematical challenges in the applications or study of origami.
There are several mathematical challenges in the applications or study of origami.
There are several mathematical challenges in the applications or study of origami.

sen.j: 例えば、展開図を二次元の作品へと平らに折りたためるかどうかの問題 (flat-foldability) はそういった数学的課題のうちの一つである。
sen.e: For example, flat-foldability, an issue on whether or not a crease pattern can be folded into a two-dimensional model, is one of the mathematical challenges.
For example, flat-foldability, an issue as to whether or not a crease pattern can be folded into a two-dimensional model, is an example of a mathematical challenge.
For example, flat-foldability, an issue as to whether or not a crease pattern can be folded into a two-dimensional model, is an example of a mathematical challenge.

sen.j: 平らな紙は表面のどの点においてもガウス曲率が0である。
sen.e: If paper is flat, the Gaussian curvature is zero at any points on the surface.
If the paper is flat, the Gaussian curvature is zero at any point on the surface.
If the paper is flat, the Gaussian curvature is zero at any point on the surface.

sen.j: よって折り目は本来曲率0の直線である。
sen.e: Therefore, a crease line is fundamentally a straight line with the Gaussian curvature of zero.
Therefore, the crease line is fundamentally a straight line with a Gaussian curvature of zero.
Therefore, the crease line is fundamentally a straight line with a Gaussian curvature of zero.

sen.j: しかし濡れた紙や指の爪でしわをつけた紙など、平らでなくなった紙においては最早この曲率の条件はあてはまらない。
sen.e: The condition of this curvature cannot be, however, applied anymore to warped paper such as wet paper and paper wrinkled by a finger nail.
The condition of this curvature cannot be, however, applied anymore to warped paper such as wet paper or paper wrinkled by a finger nail.
The condition of this curvature cannot be, however, applied anymore to warped paper such as wet paper or paper wrinkled by a finger nail.

sen.j: 剛体折り紙の問題（即ち、折り目の位置で蝶番でつないだ板金を用いて、紙と同様に作品を折ることができるかどうか）は重要な実用上の問題である。
sen.e: The problem of rigid origami (whether or not a model can be folded like paper by using sheet metal with hinges in place of crease lines) is an important issue for practical use.
The problem of rigid origami (whether or not a model can be folded like paper by using sheet metal with hinges in place of crease lines) is an important issue pertaining to practical use.
The problem of rigid origami (whether or not a model can be folded like paper by using sheet metal with hinges in place of crease lines) is an important issue pertaining to practical use.

sen.j: たとえば、ミウラ折りは剛体でも折ることができ、人工衛星の太陽電池パネルを折り畳むために用いられている。
sen.e: For example, the Miura map fold allows a rigid body to be folded and has been used to fold large solar panels for space satellites.
For example, the Miura map fold allows a rigid body to be folded and has been used to fold large solar panels for space satellites.
For example, the Miura map fold allows a rigid body to be folded and has been used to fold large solar panels for space satellites.

sen.j: またそれ以外にも、折り紙はエアバッグの折り畳みや医療用のステントグラフトの折り畳みにも応用されている。
sen.e: In addition, origami has been applied to fold air bags and stent grafts for medical use.
In addition, origami has been applied to fold air bags and stent grafts for medical use.
In addition, origami has been applied to fold air bags and stent grafts for medical use.

tit.j: 折り紙に関連する人物一覧
tit.e: List of people related to origami
List of people related to origami
List of people related to origami

sen.j: 折り紙作家は幾人もいるが、プロとして活躍しているものは一握りしかいない。
sen.e: There are some origami artists, but only a handful of artists working as professional.
There are some origami artists, but only a handful of artists working as professional.
There are some origami artists, but only a handful of artists working as professional.

sen.j: プロの折り紙作家は折り図を収録した本を執筆し、生計を立てているものが多い。
sen.e: Many professional origami artists write origami books containing folding diagrams to make their living.
Many professional origami artists write origami books containing folding diagrams to make their living.
Many professional origami artists write origami books containing folding diagrams to make their living.
